data.title: Franck, James, 1882
data.text:
James Franck

Dates

August 26, 1882 – May 21, 1964

Authorized Form of Name

Franck, James, 1882-1964

Additional Forms of Names

Biography

Abstract

James Franck was Professor Emeritus of Physical Chemistry at the University of Chicago (1938-1964). Other institutional affiliations included Johns Hopkins University and the University of Copenhagen. His research interests included quantum theory and for the quantum mechanical description of atoms and molecules.

August 26, 1882Birth, Hamburg (Germany).

1906Obtained PhD in Physics, University of Berlin (Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Berlin), Berlin (Germany).

1906 – 1918Assistant in Physics (1906-1911); Privatdozent (1911-1916); and Associate Professor of Physics (1916-1918), University of Berlin (Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Berlin), Berlin (Germany).

1918 – 1920Head, Physics Division, Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Physical Chemistry (Kaiser Wilhelm-Gesellschaft zur Furderung de Wissenschaften).

1920 – 1933Professor and Director of the Second Institute for Experimental Physics, University of Göttingen (Universität Göttingen), Göttingen (Germany).

1925Awarded Nobel Prize in Physics with Gustav Hertz "for their discovery of the laws governing the impact of an electron upon an atom".

1933Speyer Professor, Johns Hopkins University.

1934 – 1935Guest Professor, University of Copenhagen (Københavns universitet).

1935 – 1938Professor, Johns Hopkins University.

1938 – 1964Professor of Physical Chemistry (1938-1947); Head, Photosynthesis Research Group (1949-1956); and Professor Emeritus of Physical Chemistry (1947-1964), University of Chicago, Chicago (Ill.).

1942 – 1945Director, Chemistry Division (1942-1943); Associate Director (1943-1944); and Consultant (1944-1945), Chicago Metallurgical Laboratory, Manhattan Project.

1944Member, National Academy of Sciences.

May 21, 1964Death, Göttingen (Germany).

Occupation

Atomic physicist.

Advisors & Collaborators

Blackett, P. M. S. (Patrick Maynard Stuart), Baron Blackett, 1897-1974

Advised by Franck at Universitat Gottingen.

Condon, Edward Uhler, 1902-1974

Advised by Franck at University of California, Berkeley and collaborated on the Franck-Condon principle.

Hertz, Gustav, 1887-

At University of Berlin carried out seminal studies of elastic collisions between electrons and inert gas atoms and shared the 1925 Nobel Prize in Physics "for their discovery of the laws governing the impact of an electron upon an atom."

Herzberg, Gerhard, 1904-1999

Advised by Franck at Universität Göttingen (University of Göttingen).

Kopfermann, Hans

Advised by Franck at University of Heidelberg.

Kuhn, H. G. (Heinrich Gerhard), 1904-

Advised by Franck at University of Göttingen.

Loomis, F. W. (Francis Wheeler), 1889-1976

Worked with Franck at University of Göttingen.

Mayer, Joseph Edward, 1904-

Advised by Franck while a post-doc at University of Göttingen, both employed at Johns Hopkins University and at University of Chicago.

Rabinowitch, Eugene, 1901-1973

Advised by Franck while post-doc at University of Georg-August-Universität Göttingen.

Tate, John T. (John Torrence), 1889-1950

Advised by Franck at University of Berlin in the heat of vaporization of metals.

Von Hippel, Arthur R. (Arthur Robert), 1898-

Advised by Franck at University of Göttingen.

Warburg, Emil Gabriel

PhD advisor at Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Berlin on the mobilities of ions in gaseous discharges.
